definition: to push or put (someone or something) in a rough, careless, or hasty manner : thrust, shove
examples: I would hunch my chair … closer to my dear and only cronies
— Mary Nash

definition: to thrust or bend (someone or something) over into a humped or crooked position
examples: hunched his shoulders as he headed out into the storm
sat hunched over the table reading a map
kept his … body hunched slightly forward
— Tennessee Williams
hunched along for a short spell of safe steps
— T. B. Costain

definition: to assume a bent or crooked posture
examples: folded his hands on the table and hunched forward
— Hugh MacLennan

definition: to draw oneself into a ball : curl up
examples: hunch beneath the covers
— Randall Jarrell
we hunched close to the damp earth
— H. D. Skidmore
the mountains hunched around the valley
— Helen Rich

definition: an act or instance of pushing someone or something in a rough or careless manner : an act or instance of hunching (see hunch entry 1 sense transitive)
examples: give him a good hunch with your foot
— Abraham Tucker
barter it for a hunch of cake
— Flora Thompson
his back carried a huge hunch
— William Scoresby

definition: a strong intuitive feeling concerning especially a future event or result
examples: had a hunch I would find you here
